instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keyboard backlight 4.9v
threads.message:
Board originally was not recognizing webcam , I replaced <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> as all voltages were present but forgot about clock signal (missing clock signal). Now not getting Keyboard backlight no voltage on enable to <CHIP>U7750</CHIP> (0v on <SIGNAL>SMC_SYS_KBDLED</SIGNAL>), checked trace to smc  was good, checked fb resistor and traces, good. Replaced smc still same. Tried clean bios and good keyboard backlight but still the same. Tries boot into different Os still no backlight.

Any help appreciated

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keyboard backlight 4.9v
threads.message:
ALS working?
Try known good LCD assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keyboard backlight 4.9v
threads.message: Yes I have tried working assembly previously.  if <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> is not good would that also cause this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keyboard backlight 4.9v
threads.message:
ALS connects to SMC.
Did you check if LCD backlight reacts when direct flashlight to webcam?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Keyboard backlight 4.9v
threads.message: Yes it has no effect. I have changed <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> again and it seems to be working now . Just reassembling to fully test.
